Posts.Content: frd1083 wrote: I was scheduled to see a breast surgeon tomorrow, waiting since January 15 when another surgeon found lump and wanted it out within the month. Got a letter saturday that said they cancelled my appt and rescheduled to feb. 23. So that was it, the flood gates opened and I really cried which I have not done much of. And of course, I am still bleeding from god knows what, long period that stopped and restarted. So I have just about had it. So now what, I am not sure I can wait for another 2 1/2 weeks not knowing what I am dealing with. I am tempted to go back to first surgeon who is not a breast specialist but does do these types of excisional biopsies and had a very nice way about him. I just thought a breast surgeon might be a better option for me. Anyway, I will start calling tomorrow at 8:30 to fight a battle to see if I can at least have an us to see if that shows anything. the mamm did not, just microcalcifications. Any opinions Thanks Faith Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: appt cancelled frd1083 frd1083

Posts.Content: frd1083 wrote: Just wanted to post today. Wednesday after meeting with surgeon who was confident I did not have anything I was elated, went to dinner with my husband and breathed a big sigh of relief. She had ordered an ultrasound just to cover our bases, but left the room saying she would see me again in May or June. Yesterday I went to for us and they found lots of cysts but one had debris which caused little concern but another had a good size white blob of calcification in it or nodule. My heart sank, but was so glad I had the ultrasound. I will have a biopsy I believe according to the radiologist who met with me, but I have to go back to surgeon on Tuesday as she has to order what she feels is the best thing to do. I felt better yesterday than today. I just cannot sleep and that is slowing becoming a problem. I work everyday so that has helped keep me busy, but I am just TIRED. I am ready to jump to next phase, but wish I did not have a day of YIPPEE as it is hard to get back. Thanks for listening girls. Have a nice Friday and weekend. Faith Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Feeling overwhelmed this a.m. and tired frd1083 karcan

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2012 04:22AM frd1083 wrote: well I guess that certainly takes the MRI out of the equation with the metal I am hobbling around with.  I did not even think about it at the time when I was talking about the MRI option with my gynecologist so.....   I guess we wait and see.
Posts.Title: Birad 3 and dense breast tissue frd1083 Hipline

Posts.Content: frd1083 wrote: just posted that surgeon thought I was fine, but had us today and they found lots of cysts and one had a calcification inside that they want out. So I am back to surgeon next Tuesday. Radiologist mentioned large core needle so would this be a core biopsy?? They did say it would be ultrasound guided as you cannot feel this one. She said it does not scream cancer, but she is concerned. Also cannot take aspirin, what can I take for headache, etc. Thanks Faith Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ultrasound today and now biopsy frd1083 VickiTN

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2012 09:57AM frd1083 wrote: Well surgeon felt an MRI was not necessary so I guess I am waiting. There is no palpable lump and these are new punctate calcifications. I can't say I am fine with the decision but I will see how I feel in a few months. If things seem weird or changed I will push to be seen. Everything seems like such a fine line.
Posts.Title: Birad 3 and dense breast tissue frd1083 Hipline

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2012 01:06AM frd1083 wrote: Well say new gyno yesterday for routine annual and decided to speak to her about mammogram, etc.   Loved her first and foremost, so I was happy from the get go.  She did a breast exam and then said "You are too dense to feel much of anything" so I asked her what her opinion was relative to the new microcalcifications and birad 3 and extremely dense breast tissue.  Would you wait the six months and see?  Because quite honestly I felt I was prepared to wait and perhaps I was overreacting.  I think sometimes you feel that way when you have 3 biopsies and they are benign.  She felt I should get an MRI and she would not wait.  We left it that she would connect with the breast surgeon and get back to me.   So I guess I have decided to leave it in her hands as getting approval for it may take a bit.  We shall see how things go.
Posts.Title: Birad 3 and dense breast tissue frd1083 Hipline

Posts.Content: Aug 15, 2012 03:39AM frd1083 wrote: I did speak to the radiologist and she was hesitant but said maybe I should ask for an MRI.  Now thinking about it, I probably cannot either as I had a tibial plateau fx and have a plate and six screws holding the bone together.  I knew the breast surgeon would say "nope, does not need it" so I was not surprised.   I have had 3 biopsies since 2002, all benign.  Surgeon actually is sending me documentation that indicates that MRI does not find cancer..... hmmm. can't wait to read that one.   However, perhaps she was referring to the fact that MRI will not see calcifications.   I think that the false positive rate is concerning to a lot of surgeons too.   So, I guess I will sit tight and wait the six months and if anything changes before then, I will call.  Faith
Posts.Title: Birad 3 and dense breast tissue frd1083 Hipline

Posts.Content: frd1083 wrote: I have had 3 biopsies over the yrs, all b9 thankfully. Last one in 2007. I have been birad 3 or 4 quite a few times. This yr I got the dreaded call back after going 5 yrs with no callback. I could tell the mammographer was struggling to find the spot they were looking at... Anyway birad 3 see you in 6 mos. so I actually called the radiologist to chat. She said I have very dense breasts. Heterogenously dense was noted on some of my reports. I am 59 now and just went into menopause nov 2011 at age 58 but said kinda of like "looking for a pebble in a snow storm?". Her response was "yes exactly....maybe you should think about an MRI" The breast surgeon that I had 5 yrs ago is very good but at times very dismissive so not sure what to do. They did find new calcifications that were not there last year. So not sure if I should sit tight and give it 6 mos. Sorry this is so long. Any thoughts? Faith Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Birad 3 and dense breast tissue frd1083 Hipline

Posts.Content: frd1083 wrote:  I have had 2 biopsies of areas in my left breast, both benign.  However, two years ago a lump was found by one surgeon that he thought should come out.  He was not a breast surgeon so I went for a second opinion and she said it was nothing.  They do an ultrasound and found another part of the breast that was suspicious so did the core biopsy on that which was benign.  However, recently the lump the first surgeon found seems to be a bit larger.  I always thought it was a fibroadenoma and have not worried about it.  I have had this lump for 2-3 years but I have lost some weight recently (only about 8 lbs.) and appear to be entering menopause (age 56) finally so my breast tissue is not going through the usual hormone cycle so everything is much more palpable.  so.... do I call my gyn and have it checked, or wait for August for my mammogram.  I have dense tissue so you really can't see much, but I am a little more concerned because it has not decreased in size at all which I thought might happen when the estrogen stopped.  Do they ever go away? Thanks Faith Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Breast lump changed frd1083 CherylAnn
